# An example of a plotly graph

The normal version of the graph looks like this.
```{r echo = F, message = F, waring = F}
# library(plotly)
# library(ggplot2)
library(cowplot)

data(lynx)

lynx.df <- as.data.frame(lynx)
lynx.df$time <-1:nrow(lynx.df)
names(lynx.df) <- c("N", "time")
p <- ggplot2::ggplot(data = lynx.df, 
                     aes(x=time, y=N)) +
    geom_point()    + 
    geom_line()

p
```


The plotly version looks like this
```{r, warnings = F, message = F,  eval=knitr::is_html_output()}
fig <- plotly::ggplotly(p)

fig
```
